intro: Tordylium nodosum, commonly known as the nodding tordylium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly in the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Tordylium nodosum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
